intro: Corispermum macrocarpum, commonly known as the large-seeded bladderwort, is a small annual plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers with four petals, typical of the mustard family. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. It is often found in moist, sandy soils along coastal areas and is adapted to harsh, saline environments.
